last lines of his State of the Union address. Barack Obama Chuck Schumer praised the president's commonsense call for trimming the federal budget and creating jobs, without cutting programs that could hurt the American Dream. "The Barack Obama has offered a balanced approach that hopefully can garner bipartisan support. He is aware of the need to rein in spending but also the need to grow jobs, the economy and middle class paychecks. It makes sense to cut programs that are wasteful and unnecessary, but grow the programs that are needed to preserve the American dream. The Barack Obama showed the kind of optimism that America relishes, thrives on and believes in." Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand cited the 9/11 health care bill-which she helped shepherd to passage during the lame-duck session last month-as an example of the kind of bipartisan work that might be possible in this Congress. So Larry, Sergey Brin , and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making- and over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured, Eric Schmidt wrote in his post. Aaron Rodgers was all smiles yesterday as a guest on "Late Show with David Letterman ." David Letterman handed Aaron Rodgers his WWE championship belt and even caught a pass across the stage from the Super Bowl MVP. There must be a lot of Wisconsin people out there, Aaron Rodgers said as his eyes scanned the crowd, which was met with cheers from the probable Packer backers in attendance. David Letterman asked a series of light-hearted questions, with Aaron Rodgers willingly playing along.
